transcript.text: chalo mrs. Daniel John Lee with tor
restoration ministries I just making a
real short video here I don't know
what's going on but I I work from home
and during my lunch break I take a break
from 11:00 to 1:00 and about 12:00
around noon somewhere between Union and
12:30 I was just laying down to take a
short nap
during my lunch break and all of a
sudden heard this loud just pop it sound
like someone was pounding at my door so
I get up I opened my door no one's there
and I don't know what happened then I
try to be on the Internet and the
internet is not working and I don't know
what's going on so I go outside my
fiber-optic cable looks fine it's
feeding out of the house I go downstairs
because I'm actually my apartment is
above some businesses and I'm checking
the meter box down there everything
looks fine and then the guy comes out
and says hey are you from upstairs and I
said yeah I said I lost my internet I
don't know why and he said well some
sort of truck or something came by and
hit fiber-optic cables so I go across
the street and sure enough there the
fiber-optic cables the feed into my
apartment they're totally shredded I
mean they look like they're they've been
cut and mangled they're draped up over
these row of mailboxes and their
fiber-optic cables they look like
they've been cut that's what that's what
it look like anyway my provider can't
get a guy out a tech guy out until
tomorrow and I don't even know if I
don't know how long it's gonna take to
fix it but so I don't know this is just
an amazing coincidence that my
fiber-optic cable that gives me internet
happened to be cut or if this is
something else because of the videos
I've been making I don't know I'm just
gonna post this video in case it is
something else and that way there's some
documentation of what's happening so I
don't have internet access right now
except at the library I'm at the library
right now I'm just outside the library
and I'm gonna upload the try to upload
this here at the library and I won't be
able to really respond to any comments
tonight or tomorrow and
send a guy out to fix it and even if
they send a tech guy to fix it I don't
know if he's gonna be able to I mean
that the fiber-optic cable is in shreds
it's like it's like ripped ripped like
it looked like someone went to it with
like I don't know wire cutters or
something and I don't know how fiber
optic cables work I mean I would think
if it was an electrical cable you'd get
shocked
maybe fiber optic cables aren't like
that so I don't really know maybe it was
a truck to hit it I don't know all I
know is that it's shredded and it's
draped up over a real mailboxes and it's
it's been cut so keep me in your prayers
Shalom
